comments.content:
I rate Mini 7 highly, as well as Silkscreen by Michael Kottke [http://www.kottke.org/plus/type/silkscreen/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417045358/http:/www.kottke.org/plus/type/silkscreen/index.html)   
   
Theres also a few at [http://www.orgdot.com/aliasfonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417045358/http:/www.orgdot.com/aliasfonts/)   
   
and Hooge at [http://www.miniml.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417045358/http:/www.miniml.com/)

\*i looooove redensek from fontalicious.com (the only typeface i have specifically dreamed about ![:)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417045358im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif) )   
   
\* bangalore, from 9031.com , the first script screenfont i saw... and fell in love with.   
   
\* Atomic media´s remote   
   
\* v5's Eastergothic   
   
\*Silkscreen   
   
\*Bitmapmania's Gaudi   
   
\*Clickscape/clickscope by pixelarts   
   
and i really really don't like hooge ;)

Bangalore is the first great pixel script I've seen   
- and the only one until I saw Miguel's stuff.   
   
Miniml has some great work if they'd just add   
another pixel between glyphs.   
   
I'm a fan of Mark Simonson's free work:   
 [http://www.ms-studio.com/oldbitmapfonts.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417045358/http:/www.ms-studio.com/oldbitmapfonts.html)   
   
Stephen
